reviewText: Not bad.  Gives you an overview of sights to see in Yellowstone.
Not the best, but not bad.  A bit dated
This book proved to be invaluable during or trip to Yellowstone.
great dvd-very informative and learned alot so when we visit-we will be ahead!
Good, sort of generic, but useful if you are going to the park.

nothing what I was looking for, focused mostly on the Geysers & Geyser history
seemed outdated...I wanted a tour of the entire park, hi-lighting all the parts, maybe advice on when to see what
hints, tips, etc....nothing like that.
Waste of my money!
It was very good. I used it along with a creative writing assignment so that the students could get a visual fellof Yellowstone as none have ever been there.

Great video; but buy the audio version instead.
the video and audio editing is choppy. This video uses the Audio from Way point tours audio tour of the same name; but has many parts missing from the original. Some places the editor cuts off narration mid sentence. The video adds to the sound-but leaves out key elements from the original sound track.

I bought the video because I was going to Yellowstone National Park.  I was looking forward to seeing the beautiful scenery and wild animals, especially the bison.  Video came in with a very good, clear picture.  This video helped me plan my trip because I could decide what attractions I wanted to see and those I'd skip.  Yellowstone is a huge park and planning one's time is the key to a great trip. I recommend this video for anyone planning on traveling to Yellowstone.
